item.title: Emily add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Emily add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Emily add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Emily add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "You forget what you want to remember, and you remember what you want to forget." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Emily add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "Just remember that the things you put into your head are there forever, he said. You might want to think about that. You forget some things, dont you? Yes. You forget what you want to remember and you remember what you want to forget." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Emily add a quote by Adam Lindsay Gordon
item.description: "Life is mostly froth and bubble, Two things stand like stone. Kindness in another's trouble, Courage in your own." -- Adam Lindsay Gordon

item.title: Emily add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Every time you smile at someone, it is an action of love, a gift to that person, a beautiful thing." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Emily add a quote by John Adams
item.description: "Let us tenderly and kindly cherish therefore, the means of knowledge. Let us dare to read, think, speak, and write ." -- John Adams

item.title: Emily add a quote by James Truslow Adams
item.description: "There are obviously two educations. One should teach us how to make a living and the other how to live. Surely these should never be confused in the mind of any man who has the slightest inkling of what culture is. For most of us it is essential that we should make a living...In the complications of modern life and with our increased accumulation of knowledge, it doubtless helps greatly to compress some years of experience into far fewer years by studying for a particular trade or profession in an institution; but that fact should not blind us to anotherâ€”namely, that in so doing we are learning a trade or a profession, but are not getting a liberal education as human beings." -- James Truslow Adams

item.title: Emily add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Emily add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch
